data.title: Belgium – Page 97 – POLITICO
data.meta_description: Latest politics, government and election news for Belgium
data.text:
Google’s European obstacle course

New and existing laws could expose the company to more claims.

Hours before major summit, a bomb scare

The false alarm forced the closure late Tuesday of the area around the European Council building.

Uber expands in France, despite crackdown

As Uber’s French connection strengthens, taxi drivers warn the ride-sharing service to stay out — or else.

Murdoch’s EU-turn

There are signs that the media mogul, a famous Brussels-basher, may be ready to try to keep Britain in Europe.

POLITICO PRO’s Morning Health Care

Our inaugural edition: Patients’ patience snaps — Faster access to drugs under the spotlight — Belgian MEP wants joint price negotiations for orphan drugs

Burundi unrest endangers EU election mission

Negotiations between the EU and the Burundian government on the continuation of the EU mission are ongoing.

Europe’s great data divide

Not all countries are created equal when it comes to mobile data usage in the European Union.

Four things America can learn from Europe’s trains

Following the deadly Amtrak derailment last week, the US should study how the EU does it better on rail transportation.

Map — Brussels lobbyists’ square mile

The European quartier in Brussels is a hotspot for lobbyists, who are housing in the blocks surrounding the institutions.

The Brussels Gucci gulch

As the European Parliament accrues power, lobbyists are moving their offices into its orbit.

Belgium targets Facebook tracking

Social network could face lawsuit if it doesn’t comply, but claims lack of jurisdiction

Europe shareholders may get ‘say on pay’

MEPs want to inject more transparency into corporate governance.

Commission and Parliament want to give Uber a free ride

MEPs and Commissioners look to creative solutions in dealing with member states on Uber.

Belgium-Luxembourg mobile number deal stokes carrier hopes

How to get round roaming? Multiple numbers on one SIM card.

Industry spooked by talk on joint drug buying

Some want to extend a joint buying effort used only thus far during Ebola scare.

Drugmakers on defense against Belgian-Dutch pricing bid

Drugmakers want to be able to charge different prices to different countries.

Uber’s European breakthrough

Brussels is embracing Uber, set to make ride sharing legal.

Belgium, Netherlands team up to take on pharma over prices

Until now pricing was almost exclusively negotiated between one country and company.

Seafood show sends Brussels Group packing

Brussels’ hotels are sold out — but it’s not the technocrats of the Brussels Group filling the spaces.

The birth of a new publication

Editor in chief John F. Harris and executive editor Matthew Kaminski trade thoughts on the new POLITICO Europe.

Loss of cross-border train services in Belgium follows worrying trend

The Belgian government’s decision to end subsidies for Thalys services to small towns in Wallonia has raised questions over the ‘right to rail’, writes Dave Keating

MEPs’ tax inquiries take shape

Members of special tax committee suggested ideas for its initial six-month mandate in its first business meeting.

EEAS reveals name of official killed in Mali

Belgian security officer was one of five people killed in attack on restaurant in Bamako.
